Harry Enfield came up with characters Loadsamoney, who went on and on about how much he earned, and Buggerallmoney, his poor northern cousin
Britain had always had very poor people (cf The Road to Wigan Pier, 1937). Don McCullin's photos from early 1970s show terrible deprivation
But Thatcher had little time for the less fortunate, those without the drive to succeed; under her, the least well-off began to be cut loose
Thatcher broke the shackles restraining entrepreneurs and the people with drive; privatised firms, such as the joke that was British Airways
On Thatcher (I lived in UK from 1974-88); in 1979, country was in trouble. Unions out of control, factories producing junk, tax rates crazy
